events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of April 30th, causing significant damage to the front bumper and hood of the car.
The claim was reviewed and classified under Auto Accident based on the details regarding the car collision provided by the claimant.
A claims adjuster was assigned to the case to begin further processing and to assist the client with next steps and documentation requirements.
Confirmation was sent to the claimant acknowledging receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining the investigation timeline.
The claimant was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to support the investigation process.
The claimant promptly submitted all requested documents including detailed images of the accident damage and the official police report.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and reached out for additional verification of the collision circumstances.
After thorough analysis, the investigation into the car accident was completed with validation of damages and liability confirmation.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering vehicle repairs and minor medical expenses incurred due to the accident.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and appreciated the timely communication from the claims team.
The claim was officially approved following acceptance of the proposed settlement amount and agreement on repair plans.
The payment covering repair costs and related expenses was issued promptly to the claimantâ€™s designated bank account.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation that the claimant received payment and repair work commenced.
All case documents and communications were archived in the system for future reference and compliance with company policies.
